clean_content:
Definition / general

* Benign or potentially low grade malignant cystic epithelial neoplasm composed of cells which contain intracytoplasmic mucin ([ICD-O: 8470/0 [Accessed 18 February 2021]](https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/96612/9789241548496_eng.pdf?sequence=1#page=73))* WHO classification:
    + MCN with low grade dysplasia (adenoma)+ MCN with high grade dysplasia (carcinoma in situ)+ MCN with invasive carcinoma

Essential features

* Cystic neoplastic lesion that is a precursor to pancreatic adenocarcinoma* May harbor invasive carcinoma* Presence of associated ovarian type stroma

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [C25](http://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/C15-C26/C25-/C25) - Malignant neoplasm of pancreas (if malignant)* ICD-10: [D13.6](http://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D13-/D13.6) - Benign neoplasm of pancreas (if benign)

Epidemiology

* Almost always women (> 95%); mean age of 45 years ([Ann Surg 2008;247:571](18362619))

Sites

* Distal pancreas (> 95%) ([Ann Surg 2008;247:571](18362619))* Can also occur in the liver and gallbladder* Metastases usually restricted to abdominal cavity; metastases to ovary may simulate primary ovarian tumors

Pathophysiology

* Ectopic ovarian stroma is thought to be seeded from primordial ovarian cells at early stages of embryonic development* Cysts are later formed by hormones and growth factors released by the ovarian stroma ([Am J Surg Pathol 1999;23:410](10199470))

Etiology

* No known etiology

Clinical features

* Usually a single lesion ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* May present as abdominal pain or acute pancreatitis ([Ann Surg 2008;247:571](18362619))* Majority are slow growing and asymptomatic ([Gastroenterology Res 2014;7:44](27785269))

Diagnosis

* Cytology and lab analysis of pancreatic cyst fluid from endoscopic ultrasound guided FNA* Histology of pancreatic resection

Laboratory

* Elevated carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) and presence of *KRAS* mutation in cyst fluid supports a mucinous cyst (includes MCN and intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm) ([Ann Gastroenterol;26:122](24714589))

Radiology description

* Thick walled, single, septated cyst in the body or tail of the pancreas ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* May have nodules or calcifications

Prognostic factors

* Prognosis is excellent unless there is invasive carcinoma with extracapsular or diffuse intracapsular infiltration ([Am J Surg Pathol 2015;39:179](25517958), [Ann Surg 2008;247:571](18362619))* Features associated with invasive carcinoma include increased cyst size (> 5 cm), intracystic papillary nodules > 1 cm in size and elevated serum CA19-9 ([Am J Surg Pathol 2015;39:179](25517958))* Less than 20% of cases have invasive carcinoma ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068), [Ann Surg 2008;247:571](18362619))

Case reports

* 38 year old woman with anaplastic carcinoma and mucinous cystic neoplasm of the pancreas during pregnancy ([World J Gastroenterol 2008;14:132](18176976))* 46 year old man with pancreatic mucinous cystic neoplasm with sarcomatous stroma metastasizing to liver ([World J Surg Oncol 2013;11:100](23688355))* 52 year old Japanese woman with anaplastic carcinoma combined with mucinous cystadenocarcinoma of the pancreas ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 1997;121:1104](9341593))* 65 year old man ([JOP 2012;13:687](23183402))

Treatment

* Surgical resection is indicated for all MCNs ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068), [Gastroenterology Res 2014;7:44](27785269))

Gross description

* Large (mean 10 cm)* Typically unilocular megacysts that do not communicate with ductal system, though up to 15% communicate with main pancreatic duct ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* Cyst wall is papillary, trabecular or thickened* Has mucoid / watery cyst contents* Must sample solid areas within the cyst

Gross images

Contributed by Diana Agostini-Vulaj, D.O., Wei Chen, M.D., Ph.D., Nakul Anush Ravish, M.B.B.S. and AFIP  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnGonzalez01Vulajn.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnGonzalez01Vulajn.jpg)

MCN with no connection to main duct

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnAFIPgross1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnAFIPgross1.jpg)

Unilocular cyst

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnAFIPgross2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnAFIPgross2.jpg)

Conspicuous, irregular, solid protuberances

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnAFIPgross3.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnAFIPgross3.jpg)

Multiloculated cystic lesion

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasmcngrossAFIP4.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/images/pancreas/4_028L.jpg)

36 year old   
woman: large   
 cyst with   
solid tumor

[![Mucinous cystic neoplasm](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticfluidanalysisChenRavish01.jpeg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticfluidanalysisChenRavish01.jpeg)

Mucinous cystic neoplasm

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreasmcngross1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3132118/figure/F3/)

39 year old man with multilocular cyst with thick mucin

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Large cyst lined by intestinal, pseudopyloric or gastric foveolar type epithelium that often form papillae, surrounded by characteristic dense ovarian type stroma ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* Epithelial lining has variable atypia (none, low grade, high grade); scattered neuroendocrine cells may be present* Invasive adenocarcinoma may or may not be present; must sample extensively to rule out an invasive component ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068), [Am J Surg Pathol 1999;23:1320](10555000))* Calcifications are common* May have mural nodules with features of giant cell tumor, malignant fibrous histiocytoma or anaplastic
          carcinoma

Microscopic (histologic) images

*Contributed by Raul S. Gonzalez, M.D. and Matthew W. Rosenbaum, M.D.*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Gonzalez01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Gonzalez01.jpg)

Spindled ovarian type stroma

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Gonzalez02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Gonzalez02.jpg)

Focal minute papillation

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Gonzalez03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Gonzalez03.jpg)

Foveolar mucinous epithelium

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum04.jpg)

Classic ovarian type stroma

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnGonzalez02n.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcnGonzalez02n.jpg)

MCN with invasion

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum05.jpg)

Estrogen receptor

Cytology description

* Cyst aspirates are usually acellular with thick, gelatinous mucus* Clusters of 3 dimensional atypical glandular cells with hyperchromasia predict at least moderate dysplasia ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2009;133:388](19260745))

Cytology images

*Contributed by Matthew W. Rosenbaum, M.D.*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum06.jpg)
 
[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum07.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum07.jpg)
 
[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum08.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreasmcn_Rosenbaum08.jpg)

Cytology of mucinous cystic neoplasm

Positive stains

* Ovarian type stroma:
  [CD10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd10.html),
  [ER](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainser.html),
  [inhibin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsinhibina.html),
  [PR](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsprog.html),
  [smooth muscle actin (SMA)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html) and
  [vimentin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsvimentin.html)
  ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* Epithelium stains [carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscea.html), [CK7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck7.html), [CK8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck8.html), [CK18](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck18.html) and [CK19](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck19.html) ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* Gastric type epithelium stains [MUC5AC](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmuc2.html#muc5ac) ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* [DPC4 (MADH4, SMAD4)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdpc4.html),
        [MUC5AC](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmuc2.html#muc5ac) present in situ areas (usually lost in invasive disease) ([Am J Surg Pathol 2000;24:1544](11075857), [Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068), [Arch Pathol Lab Med 2015;139:24](25549142))* Invasive component stains [MUC1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsema.html)* Cyst fluid may stain positive for [Alcian blue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalcianblue.html) and [mucicarmine](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmucins.html)* [S100P](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100p.html) in epithelium ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2015;139:24](25549142))* [SF1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainssf1.html) in stroma ([Pathol Int 2016;66:281](27060902))

Negative stains

* [MUC1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsema.html) (except in invasive components) ([Am J Surg Pathol 2002;26:466](11914624), [Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* [MUC2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmuc2.html) (except for faint staining of goblet cells)* [DPC4 (MADH4, SMAD4)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdpc4.html) staining is lost in invasive MCNs ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* [pVHL](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsvhl.html) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2015;139:24](25549142))

Molecular / cytogenetics description

* *KRAS* mutations noted in in situ or invasive areas, inactivating *SMAD4* and *TP53* mutations in more advanced MCNs ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))* Negative for *GNAS* mutations

Sample pathology report

* Pancreas and duodenum, Whipple resection:
  + Mucinous cystic neoplasm with low grade intraepithelial neoplasia (8.3 cm) (see comment)+ Negative for high grade intraepithelial neoplasia or malignancy.+ Focal background chronic pancreatitis+ Margins of resection unremarkable.+ Seven benign lymph nodes.+ Comment: The gross cystic lesion was entirely submitted for microscopic analysis.* Pancreas and duodenum, Whipple resection:
    + Focal adenocarcinoma arising from a mucinous cystic neoplasm (see synoptic report)

Differential diagnosis

* [Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasipmn.html):
  + Usually at the head of pancreas and communicates with the duct system (MCNs usually do not communicate with the main pancreatic duct)+ IPMNs may be positive for *GNAS* mutations while MCNs will be negative ([Gut Liver 2015;9:571](26343068))+ Both have elevated CEA and *KRAS* mutation in cyst fluid* [Ovarian mucinous tumors](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/ovarytumormucinouscarcinoma.html):
    + Similar clinical and histologic appearance* [Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, large duct variant](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasductal.html):
      + Will have smaller cysts, clustering of ducts and myxoid stroma ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2009;133:423](19260748))* [Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasductal.html):
        + Usually not cystic, shows irregular infiltrative glands with nuclear atypia, no ovarian type stroma* [Pancreatic pseudocyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspseudocyst.html):
          + Mimics MCN when MCN has denuded cyst lining
          + MCN cystic fluid has high CEA content and viscosity, high expression of microRNAs, lower amylase (< 250 U/L) and elastase I than pseudocyst, although values may vary within different loculi of same neoplasm ([Am J Clin Pathol 1993;100:425](7692722), [Ann Gastroenterol 2013;26:122](24714589), [Gastroenterology Res 2014;7:44](27785269))* [Serous cystadenoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasserous.html):
            + Has low levels of CEA
